com.edugility.liquiunit
Class JPARule

java.lang.Object
  org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      com.edugility.liquiunit.JPARule
All Implemented Interfaces:
TestRule
public class JPARule
extends ExternalResource

An ExternalResource that sets up an EntityManager before each JUnit test run.

Clients may choose whether a single EntityManagerFactory is used to create all EntityManagers, or whether an EntityManagerFactory is created and closed before and after each test run.

Although creating an EntityManagerFactory can be a heavyweight operation, it offers much more isolation than the alternative, and the intensity of its resource usage can be offset by running tests in parallel.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
EntityManagerFactory, ExternalResource, Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory(String)

Constructor Detail

JPARule

public JPARule(Object testInstance,
               String persistenceUnitName,
               H2Rule h2Rule)
Creates a new JPARule.

Parameters:
testInstance - an instance of the test class; must not be null
persistenceUnitName - the name of the persistence unit to look for; must not be null
h2Rule - an H2Rule whose H2Rule.getJPAProperties() method will provide the connection and authentication information; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if testInstance or persistenceUnitName or h2Rule is null

JPARule

public JPARule(Object testInstance,
               String persistenceUnitName)
Creates a new JPARule.

This constructor calls the JPARule(Object, EntityManagerFactory, Map) constructor supplying it with the value of the testInstance parameter, the return value that results from invoking the Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory(String) method with the supplied persistenceUnitName parameter and null.

Parameters:
testInstance - an instance of the test class; must not be null
persistenceUnitName - the name of the persistence unit to look for; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if testInstance or persistenceUnitName is null
NullPointerException - if persistenceUnitName is null
See Also:
JPARule(Object, EntityManagerFactory, Map)

JPARule

public JPARule(Object testInstance,
               String persistenceUnitName,
               Map<?,?> entityManagerFactoryProperties,
               Map<?,?> entityManagerProperties)
Creates a new JPARule.

Parameters:
testInstance - an instance of the test class; must not be null
persistenceUnitName - the name of the persistence unit to look for; must not be null
entityManagerFactoryProperties - a Map of properties to use when creating a new EntityManagerFactory; may be null
entityManagerProperties - a Map of properties to use when creating a new EntityManager; may be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if testInstance or persistenceUnitName is null

Parameters:
testInstance - an instance of the test class; must not be null
emf - an EntityManagerFactory; may be null

IllegalArgumentException - if testInstance is null

Method Detail

before

public void before()
            throws IllegalAccessException,
                   InvocationTargetException
Creates an EntityManager and injects it into all fields in the test instance that are of type EntityManager and that are annotated with @PersistenceContext.

Overrides:
before in class ExternalResource
Throws:
IllegalAccessException - if there was a reflection problem
InvocationTargetException - if there was a reflection problem

getEntityManagerFactoryProperties

public Map<?,?> getEntityManagerFactoryProperties()
Returns a Map that will be passed to the Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory(String, Map) method to create a new EntityManagerFactory.

Note that if an H2Rule has been passed to the relevant constructor, then the Map returned will be the return value of the H2Rule.getJPAProperties() method.

This method may return null.

Returns:
a Map of EntityManagerFactory properties, or null
See Also:
Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory(String, Map), H2Rule.getJPAProperties()

apply

public Statement apply(Statement base,
                       Description description)
Overrides the ExternalResource.apply(Statement, Description) method to store the supplied Description for usage by the before() method internally and returns the superclass' return value.

It must be assumed that this method may return null since the superclass documentation does not mention whether the return value must be non-null.

Specified by:
apply in interface TestRule
Overrides:
apply in class ExternalResource
Parameters:
base - the Statement to decorate; the superclass documentation does not define what behavior will occur if this parameter is null
description - the Description describing the test underway; the superclass documentation does not define what behavior will occur if this parameter is null
Returns:
a Statement; possibly null
See Also:
before(), ExternalResource.apply(Statement, Description)

after

public void after()
Rolls back any active EntityTransaction, closes any open EntityManager, sets all fields that were injected by the before() method to null, and closes any EntityManagerFactory that was created by this JPARule.

Overrides:
after in class ExternalResource
See Also:
before()

close

public void close()
Forcibly closes any open EntityManagers and EntityManagerFactory instances, thus releasing resources.

Most callers do not need to invoke this method.

getEntityManagerFactory

public EntityManagerFactory getEntityManagerFactory()
Returns the EntityManagerFactory in effect.

This method may return null.

Returns:
the EntityManagerFactory in effect, or null

getEntityManager

public EntityManager getEntityManager()
Returns the EntityManager in effect.

This method may return null.

Returns:
the EntityManager in effect, or null
